skill.name: git-advanced-workflows
skill.description: Master advanced Git workflows including rebasing, cherry-picking, bisect, worktrees, and reflog to maintain clean history and recover from any situation. Use when managing complex Git histories, collaborating on feature branches, or troubleshooting repository issues.

security_audit.summary: The skill content is documentation only and contains no executable code, network calls, or data access. No suspicious instructions or hidden behaviors were found.

content.user_title: Master advanced Git workflows and recovery
content.value_statement: Advanced Git history tasks can be risky and time consuming. This skill provides clear steps for rebase, cherry-pick, bisect, worktrees, and reflog recovery.
actual_capabilities: Explain interactive rebase operations and options
Provide cherry-pick commands for single commits or ranges
Describe manual and automated git bisect steps
Guide git worktree creation, listing, and cleanup
Outline reflog recovery for lost commits or branches
limitations: Does not run Git commands or inspect repositories
Cannot resolve merge conflicts without user details
Does not validate project specific branching policies
No automation for cleanup scripts or hooks

use_cases.title: Clean feature branch history
use_cases.description: Prepare a linear commit history before opening a pull request.

use_cases.title: Backport a hotfix safely
use_cases.description: Apply one fix across multiple release branches with cherry-pick steps.

use_cases.title: Locate a regression commit
use_cases.description: Use bisect steps to find the commit that introduced a bug.

prompt_templates.title: Rebase basics
prompt_templates.scenario: Clean last five commits before PR
prompt_templates.prompt: Show the exact interactive rebase steps to squash and reword my last five commits safely.

prompt_templates.title: Cherry-pick a fix
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to cherry-pick a specific commit onto release/2.0 and how to continue after conflicts.

prompt_templates.title: Bisect with tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Give a step by step git bisect workflow using a test command to locate a regression.

prompt_templates.title: Worktrees and recovery
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe how to use worktrees for parallel branches and how to recover a lost commit with reflog.

output_examples.input: I reset to the wrong commit and lost work. How do I recover it?
output: Run git reflog and identify the commit before the reset
Create a recovery branch at that commit hash
Verify changes and continue work from the recovery branch

best_practices: Create a backup branch before risky history edits
Keep commits small and descriptive for easier recovery
anti_patterns: Rebasing public branches used by collaborators
Force pushing without checking remote updates
Running bisect with a dirty working directory

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all Git versions?
faq.answer: It works with modern Git versions that support rebase, bisect, worktree, and reflog.

faq.question: Does it change my repository automatically?
faq.answer: No. It provides guidance only and does not run commands or modify files.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my CI or scripts?
faq.answer: It can suggest steps, but it does not execute or configure CI pipelines.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No. It does not read files, environment variables, or network resources.

faq.question: What if I cannot resolve a conflict?
faq.answer: Share the conflict details and current status to get targeted steps.

faq.question: How is this different from basic Git help?
faq.answer: It focuses on advanced workflows like bisect, reflog recovery, and worktrees.
